content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-162-31-B
|Item_parent=Sexually transmitted infections (STI): gonococcal, chlamydial, syphilis, human papillomavirus (HPV), trichomoniasis
|Item_parent_short=Sexually transmitted infections (STI): gonococcal, chlamydial, syphilis, human papillomavirus (HPV), trichomoniasis
|Rank=B
|Title=Know how to treat HPV-related infections
|Description=None
|Heading=Management
|Contributors=
|Order=31}}
- Preventive: nonavalent vaccine, 2 or 3 doses

- Children aged 11 to 19

- Men who have sex with men: up to the age of 26

- Curative :

- Physical: cryotherapy, CO2 laser, electrocoagulation, surgery

- Chemical: podophyllotoxin

- Immunological: imiquimod

question.title: What is a treatment option for HPV-related infections?
question.description: Select the correct treatment option for HPV-related infections.

option_a.title: Preventive: nonavalent vaccine, 2 or 3 doses
option_a.description: A vaccine to prevent HPV infections

option_b.title: Curative: physical cryotherapy
option_b.description: A physical treatment option for HPV-related infections

option_c.title: Curative: chemical podophyllotoxin
option_c.description: A chemical treatment option for HPV-related infections

option_d.title: Immunological treatment
option_d.description: A treatment option that stimulates the immune system to fight HPV-related infections
